title: Roseline492
author: Roseline492
content: My country people I greet una ooh, sometimes I can't help but wonder how good or bad Nigeria would have become if  we had just one unified Religion in the country, we have Muslim and Christian religion, and the conflicts between the two religion is something else, the Muslim believes they are serving the real God instead of the Christian while the Christian also believes otherwise but Muslim seems to be more in unity than Christian because even the Christians has conflict believe among themselves as such having different churches and different believe and doctrine. But I believe if the country had just one unified religion things would have changed a bit. So my country people make una reason this matter how e for be if to say we get one Religion.

comments.author: Richbased
comments.body: Quote from: Roseline492 on September 28, 2023, 11:23:39 AMMy country people I greet una ooh, sometimes I can't help but wonder how good or bad Nigeria would have become if  we had just one unified Religion in the country, we have Muslim and Christian religion, and the conflicts between the two religion is something else, the Muslim believes they are serving the real God instead of the Christian while the Christian also believes otherwise but Muslim seems to be more in unity than Christian because even the Christians has conflict believe among themselves as such having different churches and different believe and doctrine. But I believe if the country had just one unified religion things would have changed a bit. So my country people make una reason this matter how e for be if to say we get one Religion. To me religion is not the course of dispute in our society. In as much as we don't speak same language, there is actually no way everyone can belong to one religion. Individuals can still live together happily irrespective of their various religion. There is absolutely no way everyone can believe in one thing because of the way we were brought up. I mean something you believe and it works for you how can someone convince you to leave it and join what he or she believes that works for them as well. Let's take for an instance someone that grows up seeing the parents worshipping idols and all their practices are in consonant with how they believe the idol works for them and surely it does works for them, you can see that there's no way you can tell such a family to deviate from what works for them. Likewise, someone that grows up in a Christian home seeing the family being committed to things of God like going to church, worshipping God and praising God and being hopeful that God alone can answer their prayers, you will see that it will be very hard to convince such person to leave Christianity and follow whatever you believe as well. So I believe if we can still live together even marry each other irrespective of our languages, our tribes and our ethnic group, we can still progress together despite our various religious beliefs  (religion). What matters most is bringing forth things that will bring progress and development in the society.
